_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 12:53:05 using v2.2
title: Did hospital inpatients feel staff helped them control their pain?
analysis_commentary: Much like other questions in the Survey of Adult Inpatients there is very little variation in responses over time. The proportion of inpatients who definitely felt hospital staff did all they could to help control their pain was around 71% in all years. The proportion who responded that hospital staff 'to some extent' did all they could to control their pain was around 23% in all years and those felt they didn't get support was around 6% in all years.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
